name: Vdara Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 49th floor, ours was a deluxe lake view suite. It was our first time staying at this property & it was remarkable. We were treated well by valet & bell,as well as the front desk. The room had a beautiful view of the city facing north, viewing the fountains at the Bellagio and the rest of the strip. The room was very clean & the bed was so comfortable!! The only thing that I could say to the negative is that the refrigerator didn't seem to get cold on the "guest side". The other side was stocked as a mini bar, of which we did not purchase. Privacy, non gaming & non smoking are a highlight to this hotel. Vegas is great, but sometimes you need to get away from the noise, etc. Would we stay here again, absolutely!
reviews.title: Nice hote property!

reviews.text: I stayed in a suite. Normally in a place like Vegas, you figure you're paying for the location, but this room was worth every penny. It had a dining area, televisions in every room including the bathrooms, room service, kitchen, large refrigerator, plenty of beds, plenty of closet space, it even had a washer and dryer. I really had no reason to leave the room other than for what everyone comes to Vegas to do. I even got a chance to use the fitness center on the ground floor. The view from the room was indescribable. I recommend this place to anyone who values where they spend their money.
reviews.title: Exceeding Expectations

reviews.text: Everything was first rate. Room was comfortable. Pool was great. Everyone very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend Vdara to anyone coming to Vegas. Perfect location on the Strip, convenient to everything.
reviews.title: Vdara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first visit to Vegas and despite the Vdara being highly recommended by family I was concerned we’d miss out on the ‘Vegas Experience’ Thank goodness we took their advice and went ahead and booked. Very little queues on checkin or for the concierge, no long walk through a casino to get to your room, kitchen facilities that were useful even if only for boiling a kettle, a perfect central location and from our room on the 52nd floor one of the most amazing views we have ever had from any hotel room, we felt as though all of Vegas was at our feet. We are returning to Vegas next year and there will be no hesitation this time before booking the Vdara
reviews.title: A Great Choice Amazing View

reviews.text: I travel to Las Vegas for business 4 times a year and my one and only destination is Vdara. The no smoking, no casino make my decision simple. The room and suite are beautiful, the staff from the front desk to housekeeping to valet are friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. Just a short walk to the middle of the strip. I'll be back in June, July and October 2014. Can't wait…see you soon!!!
reviews.title: My one and only hotel in Las Vegas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OVERALL
reviews.title: Key Aspects Lacking

reviews.text: Vdara is a beautiful, clean, non-gaming and non-smoking hotel, and the rooms (given their size and the hotel's central location) are a reasonably good value. However, the check-in experience, room amenities, and hotel facilities are all lacking. With so many options available on or near the Strip, I would not likely stay again nor would I recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Great off-strip location. No casino a plus!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Check-in staff is inattentive
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Room is beautiful and spacious but lacks some key amenities
reviews.title: Consider it a boutique Condo-hotel, with very limited extras, poor reception staff, difficult way-finding from the Strip

reviews.text: - Room service and housekeeping staff are prompt and courteous
reviews.title: Brand new and sparkling.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a surprise. Having stayed at EVERY hotel in Vegas over the years, I can tell you this is the best hotel I've seen. This hotel jumped past the Bellagio and the Venetian. Completely non-smoking, no casino, designer rooms, great staff, quality beds ... the list goes on and on. It felt more like home than any other property we've ever stayed at. The only flaws we could find were these:
reviews.title: The standout property of Vegas

reviews.text: #1) No coffee maker in the least expensive room ... Designer everything in the room and not a ten dollar coffee maker? Really?
reviews.title: Great hotel and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2#) The hated "resort fee" ... STOP IT!! The only reason hotels do this is to cheat travel agencies out of some of their commission. This only makes the hotel look cheap.
reviews.title: Good for people who can not stand cigarette smoke

reviews.text: 3#) The "free" wi-fi, which is part of the "resort fee" is so bad, it's basically useless. Amazingly, the wired ethernet connection wasn't any better.
reviews.title: Vdara restaurant update

reviews.text: 4#) Low water pressure. Although there are water issues in Vegas, this is a ridiculous idea to save water. This is why I travel with my own shower head when I go to Vegas.
reviews.title: Peace and quiet in a town that never sleeps

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot type enough great things about this hotel. The only issue with the hotel is that you can't walk directly to the hotel from the street - you have to walk through the Aria or the Bellagio - no big deal once you know the way in. But, what a great location! From the lobby you can be in the Bellagio in a couple of minutes - or through the Aria you can get to City Center - right in the middle of the best part of the strip! Rooms were really big. Appointments were sleek and modern. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice with a stall shower and seperate large tub. The only issue with the room was low water pressure - but we were on the 43rd floor with a terrific view of the water show at the Bellagio. A great trade off. I would definately stay here again and recommend to all my friends.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and even Greater Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Pricey for Such Cheap Finishes

reviews.text: Check-in was very slow. There were plenty of people working at the front desk but it seemed to take an overly long time to check-in.
reviews.title: finishing touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we were placed in was 28039, which happened to be an accessible deluxe suite. It was nothing special and had some cosmetic issues. The problem that we encountered was the bathroom. The drain in the shower was clogged creating a fairly big mess all over the floor. We called down to the front desk, and they offered to have someone come up to fix the problem as soon as possible. However, we had plans for the evening and needed to continue getting ready as to not miss our concert. They graciously switched us to another room (24039). This was also a deluxe suite but not and accessible room which made the layout a bit more functional. Also, this room did not seem to have as many cosmetic issues.
reviews.title: Love the Vdara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, both of the rooms we saw were nothing special, extravagant, or luxurious. The carpet was quite uncomfortable, an unflattering color, and resembled very basic commercial carpeting. The beds were quite comfortable, and the amenities were nice as they offered an efficiency kitchenette of sorts that would be useful for someone wanting to prepare some of their own meals.
reviews.title: The way to relax

reviews.text: Had a great few days at the Vdara, It is located only minutes walk from Bollagio and all the other hotels and casinos on the Strip. The room which was an Executive suite had fantastic views of the Bollagio fountains and mountains beyond. Room well kitted out, we had to ask for cups etc for the room as my son was staying with us on the pull out. Also has kitchen and washing machine/tumble dryer which was great and we only had to call down to housekeeping to bring us washing powder which was delivered immediately, great for the fact that my son had been canyoneering in Zion and could wash out all his clothes. In all the hotel catered for all we required, it is peaceful and quiet, but has all the opportunities a Vegas hotel can offer within a stones through.
reviews.title: Great location with less crowds

reviews.text: Before arriving I had been in contact with hotel asking for a high floor with Bellagio views. Someone from customer services, Gwendolyn, responded via this site and said she would take a note and that I should email hotel again a week before travelling, which I did. On arrival the desk clerk had no record of my email, note from Gwendolyn and didnt even know who Gwendolyn was! We ended up on a lowe floor on the other side of the building as there were no rooms available. Next day we were able to move but it broke up the whole day as we had to return to hotel after 2pm and pack everything up again and move.
reviews.title: Great place to stay but poor communication

reviews.text: The next miscommunication was for the pool area. On day 2 I went down to the pool to be met by a female attendant behind a desk telling me I would have to pay $90 for a bed for the day. I explained that I only wanted to come in for an hour but she would not let me in, it was either a $90 bed or several hundred dollars for a cabana. What she failed to tell me was that there were hundreds of normal beds for residents right around the pool area. It was day 5 of my holiday before I discovered this was the case. This was really disappointing and took the shine off my stay at Vdara.
reviews.title: Excellent in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was fabulous. I could not fault it. It was clean and tidy and any requests to housekeeping were addressed very quickly. Just one small issue with the electronics for the blinds. We didnt realise the blinds could be raised via a button on the wall. Housekeeping pointed it out on day 3. Everything about the accommodation was top notch. I would definitely stay here again despite the poor communication. It was centrally located and just a short walk from Aria and Bellagio. There was security at the lift area which was good peace of mind as non residents could not gain entry. I thought about giving this rating 3 stars rather than 4 because of the very poor communication and the negative impact non entry to the pool area gave me for my holiday. I asked myself if I would stay at Vdara when I return next year and the answer was yes.
reviews.title: Modern and Quiet

reviews.text: If you are considering Vdara its a great place, but please dont get caught with the mis communications I received from people who did not represent this great hotel very well. I have given a 3 star below for service, this would have been much higher if it wasnt for my issues on arrival and with the pool. Daily room maid was excellent and definitely deserves a mention. Thankyou!
reviews.title: Relaxing and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for four nights, Monday to Friday in a city corner suite facing the mountains and the city. The views were excellent, I preferred this side of the hotel rather then the bellagio side as there is a much more open outlook, not just the sides of other hotels.
reviews.title: Clean modern and peaceful

reviews.text: The room was very large, it was very clean and welcoming. It was an excellent feeling to slide into the extremely comfortable bed at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Enjoy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel, it is a five star hotel. The fact that it is in Vegas and has competition in the shape of the Bellagio and Caesers makes it look just like another run of the mill hotel - it is not - in any other city it would be a stand out and command twice the rates.
reviews.title: Great choice, will def stay again

reviews.text: Minuses are the pool size, too small for such a large hotel, and the lack of kitchen implements unless you ask for them. Otherwise everything is excellent.
reviews.title: Vdara Magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a relaxing place where you can avoid the mayhem of the strip, yet are just five minutes walk away, this is the hotel.
reviews.title: Great non-smoking hotel in the heart of City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As non-smokers we appreciate a hotel, like the Vdara, that is designated "non-smoking". Our room was mini-suite style with the TV wall separating the sleeping area from the sitting area. The hotel is quite new, so all of the furnishings were stylish and in very good condition.
reviews.title: Newer, Non-Smoking Hotel in Las Vegas

reviews.text: There isn't a casino in the hotel, so it has a quieter atmosphere. A walkway connects the Vdara to the Airia and to the Bellagio for casino action, shows, and more dining choices.
reviews.title: Very nice but a bit far.

reviews.text: We enjoyed the Vdara and we would stay there again.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: The hotel had everything we wanted we even tried out the spa! There is no casino at this hotel but next door is belagio and aria and they both have casinos to enjou!
reviews.title: Oasis without feeling far away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative thing and I mean ONLY thing, is the location, you are behind belagio and away from the strip. Every where you go is a 10 min walk farther, multiple that by your stay and it adds up.
reviews.title: Amazing Holiday!! Best Hotel on the Strip

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights, and was quite impressed by the nice views, the size of the room, and the excellent beds. One of the most important things for me are a comfortable bed, and a clean room. Both were met and surpassed. The bed was excellent to say the least, and the rooms were cleaned very well.Another big feature was that it did not smell like cigars and cologne like most hotels on the strip do, as it is a non-smoking hotel throughout, and does attract a reasonably younger crowd. It is pricier than some, but well worth the money. The pool outside is excellent, with good service and great drinks. The rooms are quiet, so I slept very well. I will definitely check it out again!
reviews.title: A welcome change from the usual Las Vegas old hotels

reviews.text: I extended my stay in Vegas by one day on my last trip there. Vacancies in my origional hotel were unavailable, so I decided to try Vdara being a new hotel on/near the Strip. The room was (obviously) new and modern. The kitchenette was a welcome additon to normal Las Vegas hotels. However I was greatly turned off by the cleanliness of the bathroom.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Modern but lacking the cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon checkin the bathroom was found to have a piece of 'used' soap in the bottom of the shower along with a few hairs scattered around. The smoke alarm was also consistantly beeping (every 30 seconds or so). No big deal- I unloaded my suit case and contacted the front desk to ask for both to be taken care of - I was only there for a day right? The bathroom was never cleaned up nor was the smoke alarm resolved as requested. Sleeping with a beeping smoke alarm isn't my idea of relaxation. When i mentioned this upon check out the front desk simply said "okay, thank you for letting us know". No sorry or explanation or anything.
reviews.title: OMG-The best service and an amazing price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also spent the afternoon in the Spa which was nice. Not overly amazing though.
reviews.title: luxury retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would consider returning once again to see if there were any changes made.
reviews.title: Great Escape from the Madness

reviews.text: Wonderful place to stay. Very clean and quiet since there isn't a casino on site. Hotel staff are exceptional, very friendly and helpful. Valet service is the best I've ever seen, quick and polite. I'll be back.
reviews.title: vegas vacation from louisville, ky.

reviews.text: The hotel location (at city center) the room and the view were fantastic. The service from the hotel staff was above expectations. The hotel is non gaming so there is no trudging through a crowded casino to check in but yet, the Aria, along with the attached marketplace, is within easy walking distance and has about every Vegas experience you may want. As the Terminator stated, "I'll be back."
reviews.title: Las Vegas for a birthday celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here.
reviews.title: Great hotel without casino nor cigarette smell

reviews.text: The bedroom was fantastic, great pillows, fine linens.
reviews.title: Great option for a non-gaming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in october 2013 in a Panoramic Suite.
reviews.title: Class hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at Vdara for two nights in November for a friend's birthday. The location is great, the rooms were lovely and the front desk staff is totally a pain. We booked through our Visa Signature concierge service and received a superb rate, a number of perks such as dining credit in the cafe, a bar credit and a free upgrade. Upon check-in, we were given a handicapped room and told there were no upgrades available. We didn't care for the handicapped room and asked to charge rooms. They accomodated us without problem and we continued to press them about there allegedly being no upgrade available. After the front desk staff "spoke with his manager" a corner suite magically appeared. I found the corner suite to be just gorgeous! The bathroom was huge and there were panoramic windows the entire length of the bathroom. It had double sinks, a separate vanity for make-up, a stand up show and a bathtub. The only complaint was there was not a door separating the toilet from the rest of the bathroom so privacy was a little bit of an issue. The bedroom area was a nice size and also had panoramic windows on two walls. Fortunately the blackout curtains were highly effective at keeping the sun out of the room in the morning. The bed was extremely comfortable. The sitting area and kitchen were very spacious and well equipped. The decor is modern and clean and I really liked it a lot. Upon check-out, the front desk staff unsurprisingly didn't apply any of our dining or bar credits and protested when we told them this. We ended up having to negotiate a final bill which was ridiculous considering we had paper proof of all the credits we were extended. I would stay again but would be very specific with the front desk staff about how to apply any dining/resort credits to ensure no confusion at the end of the stay.
reviews.title: Great Property But Front Desk A Pain

reviews.text: The Vdara was an excellent choice for both of my trips to Las Vegas this year. Both trips were spent with a group of friends so the spacious and modern suites were perfect.
reviews.title: Thee place to stay in Vegas!

reviews.text: The Housekeeping staff was amazing at Vdara.  Turn down service and cleaning were extremely on point.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort. Housekeeping Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vdara's room automation systems were a pleasant surprise as well. Vdara may not have a casino and is not located directly on the strip but this was actually a plus. It was great to come back to the Vdara to unwind while we could simply take a 2-3 minute walk to any of the casinos.
reviews.title: VIV A LAS VEGAS

reviews.text: I love this place! It's good to get away from the hustle and bustle of the casino resorts. Housekeeping was excellent for our suite. We got turn down service for our let out couch each night and it was made up the next morning. It made our stay that much more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Loved my stay at Vdara

reviews.text: We received an excellent rate on Hotwire for Vdara. I would have probably never chose this hotel, so Thank You Hotwire. It is a really pretty place, very modern. Smells great, too! No casino and no smoking. It was quite noisy in the lobby, though. At all hours. It seemed as though the voices and noices echoed - we arrived at 1am and there were only 15-20 people scattered around in the lobby and it was so noisy inside. Just a design thing, I guess. We were given a complimentary view upgrade. We were on the 14th floor with a view of the Aria, the silly roundabout entryway/parking/road area and the pool. The room was beautiful. various shades of brown and tan, with white. Very modern and sleek. The bathroom was very pretty, plenty of counter space. A tub and a stall shower. Lots of soft towels! We had a kitchen but didnt use it. Found it odd that there was no coffee maker. My poor husband got up really early and had to get fully dressed, go down to the cafe to get coffee. He was not amused. But thats really our only complaint. The bed was super comfy. There was a table (I think for the kitchen) and a desk, and a couch with a coffee table. So lots of places to put stuff. Large closet area, too. We did not use any of the hotel amenities (pool, gym, etc). Pool was packed the whole time - every time we looked out the window there were tons of people in it. Keep in mind it was at least 110 each day of our stay.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Valet service was quick and efficient. Check in was slow, but that was because they are very thorough when they check you in. We appreciated it.
reviews.title: THE best hotel!

reviews.text: You can take the monorail to other resorts, or you can walk to the strip. You can also walk easily over to Aria. They have a casino in there and restaurants and then the Crystals shopping area (mall). Nice central strip location really puts you in the middle of everything.
reviews.title: I love staying at Vdara.

reviews.text: Looking for a nice, clean smelling comfortable room - try Vdara.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Las Vegas

reviews.text: I absolutely loved staying here. It was my fiancee's birthday and we asked for an upgrade but nothing was available. Later that day when we came back to the room there was a card apologizing for the inconvenience and a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful, the bathrooms are amazing and we had a great view.
reviews.title: Excellant Vdara

reviews.text: My last two stays were at Aria and Palazzo, thought I would give Vdara a try, loved it. Loved that it was non gaming and non smoking. It as a quieter hotel with easy access to Aria and Bellagio. The rooms were very nice, I wouldn't hessitate to stay there again
reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised!

reviews.text: I read the other reviews and thought most were accurate except I had a great experience. I stayed on the 12th floor. There was no noise. The shades are electronic, so if you don't figure out how to use the wall control you probably don't realize that you can make the room completely dark. It's the 21st century in this hotel.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel! Beautiful inside and convenient

reviews.text: I stayed in a one bedroom, so the hotel room was very spacious with a kitchen, and a clothes washing machine and dryer. There is an easy connetion to the bellagio and a tram to the crystal mall. It takes a couple minutes to walk to the center of the strip.
reviews.title: No Smoking, No Gambling

reviews.text: I picked this place since it has no casino so it's safer and cleaner and less noisy. Aria is a minute away and so is the bellagio for gambling. The two best casino's I have been to in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Would stay again, family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaraunts in Aria, Bellagio and the crystal mall are amazing. Cheaper eats on the strip are convienent enough and go grocery shopping and fill the fridge to save money so you can gamble more!!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but no self-parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Vegas mainly as "base camp" in order to go see the Grand Canyon (via Pink Jeep tours, drive, fly, float tour of the Canyon.....excellent). We selected the Vdara based on Tripadvisor comments. A very good hotel within a five minute walk to the Strip. The room was great with two big flat screen TVs (bedroom and 'living' room although they were pretty much the same room), a nice big washroom and a kitchenette. The Vdara is part of the Aria hotel complex but unlike the Aria it does not have a casino which makes it a quieter hotel in comparison. The Vdara was also directly connected by an indoor walkway to the Bellagio complex which you could walk through to get to the Bellagio famous fountain show outside. Then simply go around the fountain and you are on the famous Strip. The Vdara is a great choice if you don't want to be on the main Strip. My only complaint would be the restaurant prices in the hotel proper. That being said there were 'normal' shops reasonably close by (e.g. Walgreens) and you could by "groceries, water" at normal prices. Other complexes had various types of restaurants with varying prices so a good night out could be had simply by exploring a little. An excellent long weekend stay.
reviews.title: A great place for a Vegas visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As Vegas first timers we were not sure which hotel to go for, we took a recommendation from the tour operator, who suggested as this was our honeymoon the Vdara might be a little quieter for a base. The hotel is in an excellent location right off centre strip next to Aria and Bellagio. some people comment here about the walk to the strip, but we found it really easy and used the route through the Bellagio and could be on the strip in 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Superb Las Vegas retreat, an escape from the wonderful craziness
Great weekend trip to Vegas
reviews.text: We had a suite on the 51st floor with a fantastic views of the fountains. The hotel is modern and simple and the suite was superb, plenty of room and very well designed (apart from the master light switch being at the door) The suite had a bedroom area, a small living room and a small kitchen area, plenty of space overall. The kitchen doesnt come equipt which was a bit of a shame.

The pool area is more than adequate for a couple of hours lounging and a dip in the water. We found we would pop to the pool for an hour each day to cool off and relax for a little. It was noticeably busier on the weekend, in fact whole atmosphere changed on the weekend when hen parties descended on the hotel, it wasn't really a problem though, just busier/noisier.
reviews.title: Vdara Suite!

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and the service good, we used the small cafe a couple of times during our stay and the food was good although service a little slow.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel three days and really enjoyed the property. The location is excellent and our family loved the convenience of the tram which is a monorail that goes from Bellagio to Monte Carlo with a stop at the upscale shopping mall. The pool area was convenient and unlike "The Hotel" at Mandalay Bay was not a 20 minute walk from our room. They could heat it a bit more but perhaps it was cold due to the rain. The pool attendant seemed a bit abrupt with my wife when our kids walked into the private pool area by the cabanas which was uncalled for considering there were no cabanas rented at all! The room itself was large, modern and comfortable but not on part with "The Hotel" when it came to the overall cleanliness of the room. There was food in the drawer from the last guest and not all of the lights, blinds, etc. worked properly. When I complained to the staff, they were very apologetic and agreed to waive some of the hotel fees. I would definitely try another stay here and hope that housekeeping can get their act together as the Vdara really is a nice property.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but Housekeeping Needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay at the Vdara hotel & Spa and would highly recommend this hotel to anybody staying in Las Vegas. City center is very clean and has excellent decor. I will be looking forward to staying here in the near future.
reviews.title: Clean hotel and pool.

reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel for a few nights up until Dec 31 2012. The room is quite spacious with luxurious decoration, the bathroom which is spacious has plenty amenities, well lighted and come equipped with a wall mounted mirror which is useful for applying make up. The only drawback is the room lacks coffee making facilities as you have to call the house keeping to get one, same thing with cutlery and small plates. Also the shower in the shower stall as well as the hand held shower in the bath tub, are a bit clogged up due to the mineral built up that reduces the water pressure. Other than this, this hotel is superb!
reviews.title: a real 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that Vdara is a smoke-free/casino-free resort which is why I choose it. The air quality in this place is SO much more clean than other places on the strip. My partner and I aren't smokers and his asthma kicks up, so Vdara was perfect. Me personally, I hate the fact that smoke penetrates into your clothes and hair. Vdara's rooms are spacious and quite comfortable with mini kitchens (fridge/two burner stove top/microwave) but who really is going to cook while on vacation in Vegas??? The bath tub was both visually stunning and AMAZING to use. The view from our 38th floor room overlooked the Bellagio pool with views to the Bellagio fountains which was quite amazing to get a new view of them this time around. It's sister resort Aria is just steps away with great shows, restaurants (plenty to choose from) and casino. Aria's air quality was also pretty good, didn't have that lingering smokey smell like in others that we've been too. Last time we were in Vegas we stayed at the Encore which was very nice and clean but I think for future visits, Vdara is the place for us. Our friends stayed at Aria and they enjoyed it very much as well.
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay at Vdara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though check-in is at 3pm, our 10am arrival was not a problem. They promptly got us into a clean room so we could relax after our flight. Fabulous service, the most comfortable bed ever and the air in this hotel has the most amazing smell, so calming. We booked here for the smoke-free, casino-free atmosphere. With the Aria next door, we didn't feel like we were missing out on anything. Will definitely be staying here from now on!
reviews.title: Our best trip to Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't do Vegas, it's not our scene but it's the flight gateway to the National Parks in S Utah and N Arizona so we stayed here on the way in and out.
reviews.title: Good if you're passing through

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had no problems with the Vdara, Just a basic suite for around £100 per night, large enough for us, good fittings & decor, good bathroom, comfortable bed, expansive views over the valley and the strip from the 42nd floor. Carry out coffee, orange juice and light bites from the Market Place cafeteria in the lobby sufficed as breakfast in the room. The bar is pricey, G&T and a Sam Adams $24 inc tip so we learnt to drink elsewhere pretty quick. Room Service menu didn't appeal much and dining room prices suggested that someone had got their fingers stuck in the trailing zero's when composing the menus. Instead, we opted for very good steaks at the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant across the strip by by mock Eiffel Tower (an hour's wait for a table during which we enjoyed some good French wines and engaged with a very hard working and skilful barman).
reviews.title: Nice hotel and room, but needs Coffee making in rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accessing the Vdara by car from the strip direction requires you to take a short notice ramp upto a peculiar elevated roundabout between the Aria and the Vdara and then do a circulatory manoeuvre to arrive at the front door and the valet parking. Once practised, never forgotten. Getting back to the north side of the strip is almost as much fun.
reviews.title: Wow! My Favorite Vegas Hotel So Far.

reviews.text: Finding it hard to score this hotel, as it was really nice, very classy looking, but ... I have gone for 4 for location, size of room and value for money on our deal.
reviews.title: Great Las Vegas Hotel

reviews.text: We had a suite, but then again so does everyone. It was a very nice, very large room, but we thought it was quite a waste of space. There was a small kitchenette, but we wondered who would ever use it? You couldn't have a family staying there as there was only one bed, and surely if you are staying vegas you are going to eat out (or maybe have room service?)
reviews.title: Love doing Vegas this way!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location right off the strip next to Aria and Bellagio.
reviews.title: Fantastic 5 star Las Vegas hotel

reviews.text: We had a suite on the 36th floor with a fantastic view over Las Vegas and the desert.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suite very well planned and very well designed with stylish furniture. Absolutely excellent bed. Suite has a bedroom area, a small living room area and a small kitchen area. The bathroom is absolutely superb with high quality materials, very stylish with both bathtub and a shower. the suite was very well cleaned every day of our stay.
reviews.title: Beyond my expectancy

reviews.text: Though the suite is slightly smaller than you might expect but all in all I have to say that this is the best hotel room/suite I have stayd in.
reviews.title: New favorite hotel in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent gym that even has free weights. Complomentary bottled water, headphones an small towels are provided throughout the gym. This is the best and most well kept hotel gym I have ever been to.
reviews.title: 3rd visit here and still loved this hotel very much.

description: Do Vegas differently and escape to Vdara Hotel & Spa at ARIA Las Vegas. This breathtaking eco-friendly, non-gaming, smoke-free, all-suite retreat by MGM Resorts International is unlike any other hotel on The Strip. Vdara Hotel & Spa is steps away from ARIA Resort & Casino and connected to Bellagio. Vdara is also a half-mile from the Roller Coaster at New York New York, and 1 mile from the Forum Shops. Amenities in suite kitchens/kitchenettes include refrigerators, stove-tops, microwaves, and cookware/dishes/utensils (upon request). The resort fee is added to all room reservations upon check-in. Hotel resort fee includes: high-speed Internet access (in-suite), local & toll-free calls, Fitness Center access, newspaper available daily, two bottles of water per day, and turndown service upon request. Vdara is also dog-friendly (not pet-friendly) and welcomes dogs up to 70lbs, or two dogs with a combined weight of 70lbs. There is an additional $50 per night fee per V Dog reservation along with $75 per stay non-refundable cleaning fee.
